Detailed Description

A set of cones with different opening angles but the same axis and apexes.

EGS_ConeSet models a set of cones with the same apex and axis but different opening angles.

Set of cones

It is defined via the following set of keys 


library = egs_cones
type = EGS_ConeSet
apex = Ox, Oy, Oz     # Position of the cone apex
axis = ax, ay, az     # the cone axis
opening angles = list of angles in degrees
or
opening angles in radian = list of angles in radians
flag = 0 or 1 or 2

The meaning of the flag variable is as follows: If set to 0, only the cones below the apex are considered (the term "below" means that the scalar product is greater than zero for points "below" the apex, where is the cone axis and the cone apex). In this case a set of cones defines a geometry with regions with the region within the inner-most cone (the cone with the smallest opening angle) being region zero. If set to 1, the cones "below" and cones "above" the apex are considered to form a geometry with regions where regions are below the apex and regions are the region indices for the cones above the apex. If flag is set 2, the geometry will have regions with the region outside of the cone with the largest opening angle having index . An example for the use of an EGS_ConeSet is found in the cones.geom example geometry file.
